InputStreamReader streamReader = new InputStreamReader(bytestream);

for (;;) {
    String line = reader.readLine();
    if (line.equals("")) {
        break;
    }
    String[] header = line.split(":", 2);
    headers.put(header[0], header[1]); //TODO: check for bad header
}

<<<explanation>>>: The read() method returns the number of bytes actually read, so you can use this value to create a ByteArrayInputStream with the correct length. By passing the bytesRead value as the length parameter when creating the ByteArrayInputStream, you ensure that only the actual data read from the stream is used. This way, you can be sure that you are reading the body data (if any) starting from the correct position in the inputstream.
